TEXT: The applicants , Mr PERSON and PERSON , are NORP nationals who were born in DATE and DATE , and live in GPE and PERSON , respectively . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , Mr. PERSON .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

On DATE ORG stayed inheritance proceedings after the death of PERSON , one of the applicants’ maternal uncles , and instructed the applicants’ mother , PERSON , to institute regular civil proceedings in order to realise her claim .
On DATE PERSON and her other CARDINAL siblings brought a civil action in ORG against PERSON ’s widow , claiming their right to a share of his estate .
Following PERSON ’s death , on DATE ORG recognised the applicants as her heirs in the proceedings . The first applicant is representing himself and the second applicant in the proceedings .
Subsequently , the other CARDINAL plaintiffs in the case died , and the court stayed the case pending the outcome of the respective inheritance proceedings and the determination of the heirs .
The proceedings resumed on DATE . The hearing scheduled for DATE was adjourned , inter alia , due to the applicants’ absence .

The next hearing was held on DATE , when the first applicant objected to the fact that the court had changed the case number . The first applicant did not attend the next hearing , scheduled for DATE .
He had meanwhile filed another submission , which the court considered pointless and irrelevant .

At the next hearing held on DATE , the first applicant again complained about the new case number . The hearing scheduled for DATE was adjourned because the court had not succeeded in serving the summons on the applicants .

At the hearing held on DATE , the CARDINAL other plaintiffs withdrew their action . The first applicant requested the court to give him time to decide whether to maintain the action . It appears that , at the end of that hearing , the first applicant refused to sign the minutes thereof because they had been written on CARDINAL pages , whereas he claimed they could have been written on CARDINAL .
The next hearing scheduled for DATE was adjourned due to the unsuccessful service of the summons on the applicant .
Since neither of the duly summoned parties appeared at the next hearing , pursuant to section CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) of LAW on DATE the court concluded that the action had been withdrawn .

In a submission sent to the court by the first applicant on DATE , he explained that he had been unable to attend the hearing of DATE because of heavy traffic . However , he did not request the full restoration of the case ( povrat u pređašnje stanje ) pursuant to section CARDINAL of LAW .

The court attempted to serve its decision of DATE on the applicant on CARDINAL and DATE , CARDINAL and DATE , DATE and CARDINAL May , DATE , DATE and DATE , DATE , DATE and DATE and DATE . Each time , the bailiff instructed the first applicant to be present at a certain place at a certain time with a view to service , but he never appeared .

The court subsequently decided to serve the said decision through its bulletin board , pursuant to section CARDINAL of LAW . It did so on DATE . The notice was removed on DATE , which date constituted service of the decision on the applicants .
On DATE , following an examination of the case file , the first applicant appealed against the decision of CARDINAL DATE .
On DATE the court declared his appeal inadmissible . Since the decision had been served on him through the bulletin board on DATE , the statutory time - limit for filing the appeal had elapsed .

On DATE , when the court bailiff attempted to serve the decision of CARDINAL DATE on the first applicant , he refused to accept it . The bailiff noted the time and date of the first applicant ’s refusal , which , pursuant to section CARDINAL of the Civil Procedure Act , constituted service of the decision on him .

On DATE the first applicant appealed against the first - instance court ’s decision of DATE . The case file was forwarded to ORG , being the second - instance court , where it is apparently still pending .
The relevant provisions of LAW ( Zakon o parničnom postupku ; published in ORG no . CARDINAL ) read as follows :

“ If a party does not appear at a hearing or fails to observe a time - limit for undertaking a certain action and thereby loses the right to that action , the court shall , upon that party ’s request and if there exists a valid reason , allow for the subsequent resumption of that action ( restitutio in integrum ) . ”

“ When the addressee of a letter ... without a legal reason , refuses to accept the letter , the bailiff shall leave it in the flat ... or hang it on the door of the flat ... [ The bailiff ] shall indicate on the service receipt DATE , time and reason for refusal of service , as well as where the letter was left , and thereby it shall be deemed served . ”
“ CARDINAL . When during the course of the proceedings it is impossible to serve a letter , this shall be executed through the [ court ’s ] bulletin board .
CARDINAL . The letter shall be deemed served on DATE following its announcement on the bulletin board . ”
“ If both the plaintiff and the respondent unjustifiably fail to appear at the main hearing , the action shall be deemed to have been withdrawn . ”
